text: Francine Joy "Fran" Drescher (born September 30, 1957) is an American television, movie, musical theatre and voice actress, television director and producer, comedian, screenwriter, model, health, LGBT rights and political activist. She is of Jewish descent. Her acting career began around 1977 when she acted in the movie Saturday Night Fever. She is best known for playing Fran Fine from the sitcom The Nanny. Her other notable movie roles include Jack (1996) and Beautician and the Beast (1997). Drescher wrote her memoirs and is a Universal Life Church minister. She was born in New York City. She is a uterine cancer survivor. She is a Democrat and a critic of capitalism. In 1985, she was raped by armed robbers. In September 2021, Drescher was elected President of SAG-AFTRA. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Presidents of SAG-AFTRA Category:Actors from Queens Category:American autobiographers Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:American movie actors Category:American musical theatre actors Category:American political activists Category:American television actors Category:American television directors Category:American television producers Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from New York City Category:Jewish activists Category:Jewish American actors Category:Jewish American comedians Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Jewish American writers Category:Jewish models Category:Models from New York City Category:Musicians from Queens Category:Screenwriters from New York City Category:Writers from Queens Category:Presidents of the Screen Actors Guild Category:Democrats (United States) Category:American crime victims
title: Fran Drescher
